basics.name: Farzad Hayat
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: I am a second-year Computer Science student, dedicated to honing my craft in software development. I am passionate about collaborating with dynamic and innovative teams, committed to personal and professional growth, and I hold a strong sense of ownership for assigned tasks. I am actively seeking a Software Engineering or related internship available starting in November 2023.

education.studyType:
● Member of College of Excellence.

● Committee member of Code Network society.

● Professional development by attending events, workshops, and programs hosted by QUT Entrepreneurship.

● 7.5/9.0 GPA

● Interests: Algorithms & Data Structures, Cryptography, Formal Languages & Compilers.

● Regular competitor in ANZAC and ICPC programming contests.

awards.title: Best Design and Aesthetics
awards.summary: Awarded at 2023 Code Network Hackathon for developing a DRC Marksheet App called Bots 'n' Bids in Flutter.

projects.name: Empathese
highlights: Conversation Interpreter built using OpenAI's Whisper and GPT-4 for 2023 UQCS Hackathon.
Developed using SvelteKit, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS.
I was responsible for building the server-side and prompt engineering.

projects.name: Ultimate Earth Championship
highlights: Checkers-like player vs computer game made using Java with Swing.
Developed over two months as a team of two using an agile development cycle.
Utilized JUnit for unit testing and user feedback for acceptance testing.

projects.name: Breakout
highlights: Adventure Android game made using Unity3D, C#, and MagicaVoxel.
Rescue the hostages and lead them to the exit.
Responsible for programming and level design.
